### OBJETIVO 
Class, take your seats! It's PRIME-time for a quiz... `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 58617`

### SOLUCION
Para poder resolver este problema tenemos que entender el algoritmo RSA para poder responder a cada pregunta que nos van hacer durante el quiz.

Tenemos que entender las siguientes variables y formulas:

c : texto cifrado
m : mensaje modulo plano
p : primo 1
q : primo 2
n : modulo
tn : totient n (euler)
e :  exponente (llave publica)  / 65537
d : llave privada

n = p * q
tn = (p-1) * (q-1)
d = e mod inv tn / inverse(e,tn)

encriptar 
c =  pow(m,e) mod n   / pow(m,e,n)

desencriptar
m = pow(c,d) mod n  / pow(c,d,n)

- problema 1 : 4636878989
- problema 2 : 93089
- problema 3 : N
- problema 4 : 836623060
- problema 5 : 
- problema 6 : N
- problema 7: 
- problema 8: 14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977119660454037678408741501

``` python
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977119660454037678408741501)
b'picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..o26cefcb2}'

```

---
### NOTAS ADICCIONALES
**RSA** (**Rivest–Shamir–Adleman**) is a [public-key cryptosystem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography "Public-key cryptography"), one of the oldest, that is widely used for secure data transmission. The [acronym](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acronym "Acronym") "RSA" comes from the surnames of [Ron Rivest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_Rivest "Ron Rivest"), [Adi Shamir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adi_Shamir "Adi Shamir") and [Leonard Adleman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Adleman "Leonard Adleman"), who publicly described the algorithm in 1977. An equivalent system was developed secretly in 1973 at [Government Communications Headquarters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_Communications_Headquarters "Government Communications Headquarters") (GCHQ) (the British [signals intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signals_intelligence "Signals intelligence") agency) by the English mathematician [Clifford Cocks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clifford_Cocks "Clifford Cocks"). That system was [declassified](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classified_information "Classified information") in 1997.[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)#cite_note-2)

In a public-key [cryptosystem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptosystem "Cryptosystem"), the [encryption key](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption_key "Encryption key") is public and distinct from the [decryption key](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decryption_key "Decryption key"), which is kept secret (private). An RSA user creates and publishes a public key based on two large [prime numbers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_number "Prime number"), along with an auxiliary value. The prime numbers are kept secret. Messages can be encrypted by anyone, via the public key, but can only be decoded by someone who knows the prime numbers.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)#cite_note-rsa-1)
